ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Central Auditory Processing Disorder (CAPD)
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Severe deficits on central tests and speech-in-noise (16% RE, 8% LE) with reduced speech recognition, associated with learning disabilities and a subarachnoid cyst affecting cortical association areas.

ordered_list.rationale_short: To assess speech recognition abilities, which were found to be reduced due to central deficits.
To evaluate auditory performance in background noise, a reported difficulty for the patient.
To assess central auditory nervous system function given the history of learning disabilities and neurological findings.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: The patient, an adolescent female with learning disabilities and a subarachnoid cyst, demonstrated severe central auditory processing deficits. Testing revealed significantly depressed speech-in-noise scores and reduced speech recognition, attributed to cortical dysfunction in the occipital, parietal, and temporal association regions. Peripheral pathology was ruled out.

tests.name: Speech-in-noise
tests.result_summary: Scores were depressed bilaterally (16% RE, 8% LE).

tests.name: Speech audiometry
tests.result_summary: Reduced speech recognition scores caused by a severe central deficit.

tests.name: Central auditory tests
tests.result_summary: Deficits consistent with dysfunction in the common association region where occipital, parietal, and temporal fibers converge.

proposed_items: Secure preferential seating to maximize speechreading and minimize background noise
Academic accommodations (e.g., untimed tests, small class sizes)
Strategies for coping with everyday activities
counseling_actions: Encourage patient to seek administrative support for accommodations
Discuss the link between morphological brain changes and auditory/academic difficulties

escalation.rationale_short: To assist in obtaining special academic accommodations for university studies.

follow_up_plan.objective: Monitor academic progress and effectiveness of accommodations.

expected_outcome: Patient successfully completed her baccalaureate degree.
Patient was on several waiting lists for admission to medical schools at the time of last contact.
